Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Lausporin-1 (natural AMPs; scorpions, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA, UCLL1c; BBMm)

Literature.Author: Zhao Z, Zhang K, Zhu W, Ye X, Ding L, Jiang H, Li F, Chen Z, Luo X. 2021
Literature.Title: Two new cationic alpha-helical peptides identified from the venom gland of Liocheles australasiae possess antimicrobial activity against methicillin-resistant staphylococci.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (76.92%) toscorpion 	VmCT1L: 23%; F=S: 15%;   GRAVY: 1.38; M Wt: 1438.731; M formula: C72H108N15O16; mol ex coeff: 5550, pI: 8.75.Chemical modification:  C-terminal amidation.Activity: active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC29213 or ATCC25923 or MRSA (MIC 5-10 ug/ml), E. faecalis ATCC29212 (MIC 10 ug/ml), S. epidermidis (MIC 5 ug/ml), S. capitis (MIC 2.5-5 ug/ml), S. intermedius (MIC 5 ug/ml) including antibiotic-resistant strains, Gram- E. coli ATCC25922 or ATCC35218 (MIC 20-80 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa ATCC27853 (MIC 80 ug/ml),  K-pneumoniae ATCC700603 (MIC > 80 ug/ml).Toxicity: human RBC, HC50 60 ug/ml.Structure:  helical in 30-70% TFE.MOA:bacteria: act on membranes via pore formation.
